item.title: Seventh (Pandemic-Exception) Annual NC PAN Eggstravaganza
item.dc:creator: NC PAN Webmaster
item.description: Remember how much fun it was last year before the pandemic? Well, this year we’re doing it again! And you won’t want to miss out! Learn how to RSVP below! Learn more about our previous Eggstravaganzas @ https://theinfamousj.github.io/ncpan/tag/eggstravaganza Raleigh When: Monday April 11, 2022, 10 am – noonWhere: Honeycutt Park 1032 Clear Creek Farm Road, […]
item.content:encoded:
Remember how much fun it was last year before the pandemic?

Well, this year we’re doing it again! And you won’t want to miss out!

Learn how to RSVP below! Learn more about our previous Eggstravaganzas @ https://theinfamousj.github.io/ncpan/tag/eggstravaganza

Raleigh

When: Monday April 11, 2022, 10 am – noon
Where: Honeycutt Park 1032 Clear Creek Farm Road, Raleigh, NC 27615
Contact: organizer via Facebook

Come and play with your charges and hunt eggs! The egg hunt will begin about 10:30 am and will be aimed at toddlers and preschoolers. A do-at-your-own-pace craft will be available. Stay as long as you can and enjoy the park afterward!

Please bring 12 plastic eggs per child filled with something – stickers, small toys, etc, but nothing edible. Consider bringing a light snack to share with others.

Egg Contents Requested in order to ensure egg treat variety. Report the contents in the comments of this Facebook post.

Morrisville

When: Tuesday April 12, 2022, 10 am – noon
Where: Lake Crabtree Park
Contact: email organizer

Come and play with your charges and hunt eggs! The egg hunt will begin about 10:30 am and will be aimed at toddlers and preschoolers. Stay as long as you can and enjoy the park afterward! No craft.

Please bring 12 plastic eggs per child filled with something – stickers, small toys, candy, etc.

Durham and Chapel Hill

When: Wednesday April 13, 2022, 10 am – 12:30 pm (rain date Thursday April 14)
Where: Solite Park 4704 Fayetteville Rd, Durham, North Carolina 27713
Contact: social@ncpan.org

Come and play with your charges and hunt eggs! The egg hunt will begin about 10:30 am and will be aimed at toddlers and preschoolers. Older children are welcome to come and help hide the eggs in advance of the hunt or to be guest videographers. A do-at-your-own-pace craft will be available. Stay as long as you can and enjoy the park afterward!

Please bring 12 plastic eggs per child filled with something – stickers, small toys, candy, etc.

Open to NC PAN members, nannies who are not yet members of NC PAN, Friends of NC PAN, friends, moms, dads, etc.

RSVPs are MANDATORY (or else your little ones won’t be able to do the craft for lack of supplies) via the form, below. All are welcome.

Submit a form.

In a Different Region or City?

Volunteer as host for your region’s Eggstravaganza on either of the weeks that bookend Easter! If you build it, they will come! Contact the NC PAN webmaster via webmaster@ncpan.org to get started. We will promote your event, add it to this post, help you gather RSVPs, and help you connect with nannies in your area.

All social events are volunteer hosted by member nannies! And hosts get a gratis membership extension as a thank you for hosting. (Or become a member altogether!)

Spread the Word

Share this image to your favorite social media outlet, and add the details of your local region’s Eggstravaganza!

item.title: Children’s Mental Health Week 2022
item.dc:creator: NC PAN Webmaster
item.description: In the United Kingdom, there is a week in February devoted to the mental health of children. We think this is fabulous! And so, we are doing our part to bring that week here to this side of the Atlantic. This year’s theme is Growing Together. Growing Together is about growing emotionally and finding ways to help […]
item.content:encoded:
In the United Kingdom, there is a week in February devoted to the mental health of children. We think this is fabulous! And so, we are doing our part to bring that week here to this side of the Atlantic.

This year’s theme is Growing Together. Growing Together is about growing emotionally and finding ways to help each other grow. Challenges and setbacks can help us to grow and adapt and trying new things can help us to move beyond our comfort zone into a new realm of possibility and potential. However, emotional growth is often a gradual process that happens over time, and sometimes we might feel a bit ‘stuck’. As caregivers/nannies, we play an important role in our charges’ mental health.

We’re participating!

Our schedule of activities follows. As always, we’d love your photographs of works in progress or works completed. Sharing with other nannies is informal education and perhaps your charge and yourself can be the mentor this time.

  • Monday (7 February): we introduce Watch one growth story and use it to start a conversation with our charge(s) about growth and the different challenges we may face. More information here.
  • Tuesday (8 February): who supports With our charge(s) we will complete this art activity to help them think about who supports them to grow.
  • Wednesday (9 February): the hard thing We will model to our charge(s) how to choose a difficult task. We will choose ours, and they must choose theirs. We then set aside an age/stage appropriate amount of time for us to each independently practice our chosen task. At the conclusion, we debrief about how we felt before, during, and after the task. We then use art materials to remind ourselves not to get distracted by dissuading feelings when we felt so much better after the practice. Resilience researcher Duckworth (2018) explains her rule in this short video.
  • Thursday (10 February): already grown With our charges(s) we will complete this art activity to support our charge(s) to look back at their past growths. Success breeds success.
  • Friday (11 February): work-week close out Watch a second growth story with our charge(s) and use it to start a conversation assessing how the activities this week have emboldened our charges to resiliently face the future. More information here.
  • Saturday (12 February): professional development Learn “How to Manage Your Child’s Emotions (and Your Own)” from the 2021 Happily Family Conference via on demand encore for Supporting Nannies. Supporting Nannies who are logged in to their account will find the link here: [membership level=”1″]https://vimeo.com/670458923[/membership]. This encore is for 24 hours only, so plan ahead and schedule time! For the general public, we offer you this link instead.
  • Sunday (13 February): movie night; 8 pm Join us for an online viewing of “Finding Nemo“, a movie about a fish who is not afraid to face challenges and grow through them and the adult who is making classic caregiver mistakes and has to learn to trust in the young one’s growth as well. Here’s the join link; all are invited.

item.title: Sixth Annual NC PAN Eggstravaganza
item.dc:creator: NC PAN Webmaster
item.description: Remember how much fun it was last year? Well, this year we’re doing it again! And you won’t miss out! Learn how to RSVP below! Learn more about our previous Eggstravaganzas @ https://theinfamousj.github.io/ncpan/tag/eggstravaganza Durham and Chapel Hill When: Thursday April 18, 2019, 9:30 am – 12 pm Where: Solite Park @ 4704 Fayetteville Rd, Durham, North Carolina […]
item.content:encoded:
Remember how much fun it was last year?

Well, this year we’re doing it again! And you won’t miss out!

Learn how to RSVP below! Learn more about our previous Eggstravaganzas @ https://theinfamousj.github.io/ncpan/tag/eggstravaganza

Durham and Chapel Hill

When: Thursday April 18, 2019, 9:30 am – 12 pm
Where: Solite Park @ 4704 Fayetteville Rd, Durham, North Carolina 27713
Contact: Laura Pearl, social@ncpan.org

Come and play with your charges and hunt eggs! The egg hunt will begin about 10 am and will be aimed at toddlers and preschoolers. Older children are welcome to come and help hide the eggs in advance of the hunt or to be guest videographers. A do-at-your-own-pace craft will be available. Stay as long as you can and enjoy the park afterward!

Please bring 12 plastic eggs per child filled with something – stickers, small toys, candy, etc.

Open to NC PAN members, nannies who are not yet members of NC PAN, Friends of NC PAN, friends, moms, dads, etc.

RSVPs are MANDATORY (or else your little ones won’t be able to do the craft for lack of supplies) via the form, below. All are welcome.

[contact-form]

Wake County

When: Tuesday April 23, 2019, 9:30 am – 12 pm DATE CHANGE DUE TO INCLEMENT WEATHER
Where: Peter Williams Park @ 1525 Lynn Rd, Raleigh, NC 27612-6819
Contact: Sammi Van Hoy, via Facebook

Join us at Peter Williams Park at 10am for an egg hunt and play date! Please bring at least 12 FILLED eggs for each child participating.

Peter Williams Park is in the Lynn Road Elementary School parking lot at the corner of Lynn Road and Lead Mine Road.

Please RSVP (on the RSVP post with # of people coming)! I’m hoping to bring some spring themed treats to share (if anyone else would like to bring things to share, please let me know)!

In a Different Region?

Volunteer as host for your region’s Eggstravaganza on either of the weeks that bookend Easter! If you build it, they will come! Contact the NC PAN webmaster via webmaster@ncpan.org to get started. We will promote your event, add it to this post, help you gather RSVPs, and help you connect with nannies in your area.

All social events are volunteer hosted by member nannies!

Spread the Word

Share this image to your favorite social media outlet, and add the details of your local region’s Eggstravaganza!

item.title: Fourth Annual NC PAN Eggstravaganza A ROARING SUCCESS
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Levenbook
item.description: Yesterday, members of the North Carolina Professional Association of Nannies and Friends of NC PAN met for the fourth annual NC PAN Eggstravaganza. It was a beautiful day at Solite Park, home of the Triangle Eggstravaganza! We hunted for spring eggs, ate a picnic lunch, created amazing egg crafts, and managed to make it into the News and Observer! We had nannies, parents, […]
item.content:encoded:
Yesterday, members of the North Carolina Professional Association of Nannies and Friends of NC PAN met for the fourth annual NC PAN Eggstravaganza. It was a beautiful day at Solite Park, home of the Triangle Eggstravaganza! We hunted for spring eggs, ate a picnic lunch, created amazing egg crafts, and managed to make it into the News and Observer!

We had nannies, parents, grandparents, charges and children on hand. Everyone had a great time. Just look at the smiling faces!

If you missed out on attending, you can make sure not to miss any further events by subscribing to our updates to be sent directly to your email address. We couldn’t have done it without everyone who showed up!

Next year, let’s make it even better!

item.content:encoded:
Remember how much fun it was last year?

Well, this year we’re doing it again! And you won’t miss out!

Learn how to RSVP below!

Triangle

When: Fri April 14, 2017, 10 am–4 pm
Where: Solite Park
4704 Fayetteville Rd, Durham, North Carolina 27713
Contact: Laura Pearl, social@ncpan.org

Come and play with your charges and hunt eggs! Egg hunts will be about 10:30 am for toddlers and preschoolers and about 3:30ish for older children. Come as early as you can and stay as long as you can!

Please bring 12 plastic eggs per child filled with something – stickers, small toys, candy, etc.

Learn more about our previous Eggstravaganzas @ https://theinfamousj.github.io/ncpan/tag/eggstravaganza

Open to NC PAN members, nannies who are not yet members of NC PAN, Friends of NC PAN, friends, moms, dads, etc.

RSVPs are MANDATORY (or else your little ones won’t be able to do the craft for lack of supplies). Email registration@ncpan.org. All are welcome.

In a Different Region?

Volunteer as host for your region’s Eggstravaganza on either of the weeks that bookend Easter! If you build it, they will come! Contact the NC PAN webmaster via webmaster@ncpan.org to get started. We will promote your event, add it to this post, help you gather RSVPs, and help you connect with nannies in your area.

All social events are volunteer hosted by member nannies!

item.title: Follow Up: (triangle) Field Day Craft
item.dc:creator: NC PAN Webmaster
item.description: Everyone had oodles of structured and unstructured physical fun during Field Day 2016, but the craft provided the perfect counterpoint for tired bodies. For the craft, children created ice cream cones out of brown construction paper triangles, cupcake liners, pompoms, glitter, and markers. Everyone’s ice cream was unique and everyone’s was different! Cheers to our […]
item.content:encoded:
Everyone had oodles of structured and unstructured physical fun during Field Day 2016, but the craft provided the perfect counterpoint for tired bodies.

For the craft, children created ice cream cones out of brown construction paper triangles, cupcake liners, pompoms, glitter, and markers. Everyone’s ice cream was unique and everyone’s was different!

Cheers to our 2015 Craft Lead, Aishia Crayton!

 

Want Crafts in Your Region?

All crafts are run by volunteer nannies and coordinated by the central Craft Lead. If you are interested in joining the craft committee and can set up a time and space to run the craft – supplies will be sent to you along with instructions – please join the Craft Committee. This opportunity is limited to members only. Join today so you can craft!

item.title: Second Annual NC PAN Eggstravaganza a Success
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Levenbook
item.description: Today, members of the North Carolina Professional Association of Nannies and Friends of NC PAN met for the second annual NC PAN Eggstravaganza. It was a chilly-yet-sunny day and Solite Park proved to be the ideal place to hunt for spring eggs, eat a picnic lunch, and create amazing egg crafts. We had nannies, parents, grandparents, charges and children on hand. Everyone had […]
item.content:encoded:
Today, members of the North Carolina Professional Association of Nannies and Friends of NC PAN met for the second annual NC PAN Eggstravaganza. It was a chilly-yet-sunny day and Solite Park proved to be the ideal place to hunt for spring eggs, eat a picnic lunch, and create amazing egg crafts.

We had nannies, parents, grandparents, charges and children on hand. Everyone had a great time. Just look at the smiling faces in the pictures!

If you missed out on attending, you can make sure not to miss any further events by subscribing to our updates to be sent directly to your email address. We couldn’t have done it without everyone who showed up!

Next year, let’s make it even better!

Event Photo Gallery

If you have any more photos to add to this gallery, email them to webmaster@ncpan.org.

item.title: Second Annual NC PAN Eggstravaganza
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Levenbook
item.description: Remember how much fun it was last year? Triangle Well, this year we’re doing it again! And you won’t miss out! Learn how to RSVP below! When: Wed Mar 25, 2015, 12–5 pm Where: Solite Park 4704 Fayetteville Rd, Durham, North Carolina 27713 Contact: Denny Corsa, social@ncpan.org Come and play with your charges and hunt eggs! Egg hunts will be […]
item.content:encoded:
Remember how much fun it was last year?

Triangle

Well, this year we’re doing it again! And you won’t miss out!

Learn how to RSVP below!

When: Wed Mar 25, 2015, 12–5 pm
Where: Solite Park
4704 Fayetteville Rd, Durham, North Carolina 27713
Contact: Denny Corsa, social@ncpan.org

Come and play with your charges and hunt eggs! Egg hunts will be about 12:30 for toddlers and preschoolers and about 3:30ish for older children. Come as early as you can and stay as long as you can!

Please bring 12 plastic eggs per child filled with something – stickers, small toys, candy, etc.

Learn more about our previous Eggstravaganzas @ http://www.ncpan.org/socializing/category/egg-hunt

Open to NC PAN members, nannies who are not yet members of NC PAN, Friends of NC PAN, friends, moms, dads, etc.

RSVPs are MANDATORY (or else your little ones won’t be able to do the craft for lack of supplies). Members of NC PAN: RSVP through BigTent. Those who are not (yet) members: comment on this post as in the example.

In a Different Region?

Volunteer as host for your region’s Eggstravaganza on either of the weeks that bookend Easter! If you build it, they will come! Contact the NC PAN social chair via social@ncpan.org to get started. We will promote your event, add it to this post, help you gather RSVPs, and help you connect with nannies in your area.

All social events are volunteer hosted by member nannies!

Spread the Word

Share this image to your favorite social media outlet, and add the details of your local region’s Eggstravaganza!
